short_description: Performs K-Means clustering on a data set
long_description: Finds cluster centroids and assigns data points to clusters using the k-means algorithm.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: Input table is the table containing the list of features by which we are clustering the data.
input_tables.description: Input table is the table containing the list of features by which we are clustering the data.

input_tables.name: CentroidsTable
input_tables.rDescription: The table that contains the initial seed means for the clusters. The schema of the centroids table depends on the value of the unpack.columns argument. Note: With centroids.table, the function uses a deterministic algorithm and the function supports up to 1596 dimensions.
input_tables.description: The table that contains the initial seed means for the clusters. The schema of the centroids table depends on the value of the UnpackColumns argument. Note: With CentroidsTable, the function uses a deterministic algorithm and the function supports up to 1596 dimensions.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table in which to output the centroids of the clusters.
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table in which to output the centroids of the clusters.

output_tables.name: ClusteredOutput
output_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table in which to store the clustered output. If you omit this argument, the function does not generate a table of clustered output.
output_tables.description: Specifies the name of the table in which to store the clustered output. If you omit this argument, the function does not generate a table of clustered output.

argument_clauses.name: InitialSeeds
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the initial seed means as strings of underscore-delimited DOUBLE PRECISION values. For example, this clause initializes eight clusters in eight-dimensional space: Means('50_50_50_50_50_50_50_50', '150_150_150_150_150_150_150_150', '250_250_250_250_250_250_250_250', '350_350_350_350_350_350_350_350', '450_450_450_450_450_450_450_450', '550_550_550_550_550_550_550_550', '650_650_650_650_650_650_650_650', '750_750_750_750_750_750_750_750') The dimensionality of the means must match the dimensionality of the data (that is, each mean must have n numbers in it, where n is the number of input columns minus one). By default, the algorithm chooses the initial seed means randomly. Note: With initial.seeds, the function uses a deterministic algorithm and the function supports up to 1596 dimensions.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the initial seed means as strings of underscore-delimited DOUBLE PRECISION values. For example, this clause initializes eight clusters in eight-dimensional space: Means('50_50_50_50_50_50_50_50', '150_150_150_150_150_150_150_150', '250_250_250_250_250_250_250_250', '350_350_350_350_350_350_350_350', '450_450_450_450_450_450_450_450', '550_550_550_550_550_550_550_550', '650_650_650_650_650_650_650_650', '750_750_750_750_750_750_750_750') The dimensionality of the means must match the dimensionality of the data (that is, each mean must have n numbers in it, where n is the number of input columns minus one). By default, the algorithm chooses the initial seed means randomly. Note: With InitialSeeds, the function uses a deterministic algorithm and the function supports up to 1596 dimensions.

argument_clauses.name: NumClusters
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of clusters to generate from the data. Note: With centers, the function uses a nondeterministic algorithm and the function supports up to 1543 dimensions.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of clusters to generate from the data. Note: With NumClusters, the function uses a nondeterministic algorithm and the function supports up to 1543 dimensions.

argument_clauses.name: StopThreshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the convergence threshold. When the centroids move by less than this amount, the algorithm has converged. The default value is 0.0395.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the convergence threshold. When the centroids move by less than this amount, the algorithm has converged. The default value is 0.0395.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of iterations that the algorithm runs before quitting if the convergence threshold has not been met. The default value is 10.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations that the algorithm runs before quitting if the convergence threshold has not been met. The default value is 10.

argument_clauses.name: UnpackColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the means for each centroid appear unpacked (that is, in separate columns) in output_table. By default, the function concatenates the means for the centroids and outputs the result in a single VARCHAR column.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the means for each centroid appear unpacked (that is, in separate columns) in output_table. By default, the function concatenates the means for the centroids and outputs the result in a single VARCHAR column.

argument_clauses.name: Seed
argument_clauses.rDescription: Sets a random seed for the algorithm.
argument_clauses.description: Sets a random seed for the algorithm.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
